page.title: 16A VISITOR'S VIEW OF RYTON
page.content: Most people who see Ryton are only passing through on the A45(T).To them the village is no more than a garage, a large pub painted to hit the eye rather than to attract it, and a blur of road signs and crash barriers. To a few it is a stopping off place for a drink, some chips or to refuel the car before heading on into Coventry; or Northampton. Yet off the road{Ryton}is a{quiet village with a{church}that is well worth a closer look. The main street winds it's way southwards between some old fashioned{cottages}to join the Leamington road. The village is{neat and{well kept}and there is an abundance of{flowers.}The village does have a{park}for the children to play in, and several places serving good {food.}It also boasts it's{"best Kept {Village"}status with a small sign.
